newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq ends higher after late-session rally.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq ends higher after late-session rally.

text.p: A late rally in several large capitalization technology shares pushed the Nasdaq higher Monday, ending three consecutive days of losses.
The Nasdaq composite index gained 9.52 points or 0.79 percent to close unofficially at 1216.42. The Nasdaq had closed lower in five of the previous nine sessions.
The session was mixed, however, with declining issues beating gaining issues 2343 to 1874 on total volume of 482 million shares.

"The day was pretty light, so I'm not sure the gain is a good test of renewed optimism. Solid earnings by Intel and some other heavyweights could be the spark tech shares need for a more sustained rally," one trader said.

Intel Corp, the most active Nasdaq issue, gained 3-1/4 to 133-3/4 ahead of its first quarter earnings report. After the market closed, Intel said it earned $2.20 a share compared to $1.02 a share last year.
Less fortunate was Novellus Systems Inc, which plunged 22 points to 53 after the company warned it may face potential financial damage from a patent infringement lawsuit.
United Waste Systems Inc fell 4-1/4 to 33-3/8 after it agreed to be bought by USA Waste Services Inc.
